page.title: 11Religion
page.content: In Dinnington there are three places for religous meetings. These are{St. {Leonards Church}(Anglican), a {Methodist Church}(both on Laughton Road),and a{Catholic chapel}which St. Joseph's primary school use for mass.This is on Lidget Lane. {St. Leonards}was built in 1868 after a fire destroyed the original building. It does not appear in the Domesday Book and the name of the parish is taken from{St. John's church}(now derelict) which is at Laughton.{St. {Leonards}has no steeple and is at present being modernised. The most interesting thing about the{church}can be found in the vestry. This is the {map}showing how the village was enclosed in 1778.This{map}is quite famous since it appears in school History books on the{Agricultural {Revolution.
